title: List spinner jumping to top on "mouse over"

labels.name: Unverified
labels.description: Issue not yet confirmed/reproduced or feature requests not yet checked for plausibility

body:
### Describe your problem!

I stumbled over an effect when using c:geo on my tablet, which makes the list spinner nearly unusable as the list spinner reacts on unwanted something like a "mouse over" event.
I own a stylus for my tablet which supports a proximity detection to e.g. open tool tips when hovering over the screen with some millimeter distance. The problem only happens when controlling c:geo with this device.

It might sound specific, but as the distinction between hovering and touching is not easy, it makes it impossible to use the spinner.

### How to reproduce?

- Open stored list
- Have many lists so that scrolling is needed, when tapping on the spinner to choose another list
- Scrolling through this list with touched stylus (or finger) is no problem
- Keep stylus hovering over some list further down but don`t touch it
- Remove the stylus

### Actual result after these steps?

On removing the stylus the list spinner jumps to the first list again.

The attached video might explain.
- First I scroll down the selection using normal swiping
- Then I hover the stylus over an entry (see the small dot on screen)
- When removing the stylus (without touch) it jumps to the beginning

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/949669/151716039-3e70c079-24a4-4abf-ae65-b098239872e8.mp4



### Expected result after these steps?

Ignore those hovering state.

### Reproducible

Yes

### c:geo Version

2022.01.30-NB

### System information

```text
Android 10, Samsung Galaxy Tab S4
```

_No response_
